title: Self-pick
description: A player has a closed hand and draws a winning tile from the wall.

title: Riichi
description: When a player's hand needs only one tile to win and the player has not claimed another players' discards, then the player has the option to declare riichi.

title: One-shot
description: A player declares riichi and then completes their hand within one go-around of play.

title: Robbing a quad
description: If a player has an open triplet and draws the fourth tile, they can add it to the triplet to make a quad. At the time, another player can win on the tile, namely, they can "rob" that tile.

title: Dead wall draw
description: When a player declares a quad, they must draw a supplemental tile from the dead wall to keep the number of tiles in the hand consistent. If that tile completes the hand, it adds one han.

title: Last tile from the wall
description: When a player draws the last tile from the wall and it completes that player's hand.

title: Last discard
description: When a player wins on the last discard.

title: All simples
description: Only numbered tiles from 2 through 8 are used eliminating terminals or honors.

title: No-points hand
description: A hand with 4 sequences and 1 pair. The pair can't be dragons, own wind or prevailing wind. Furthermore, the hand must be waiting for multiple winning tiles that can make a sequence.

title: One set of identical sequences
description: One set of two sequences of the same numbers in the same suit.

title: Honor tiles
description: Any triplets or quads of dragons, the player's wind and the prevailing wind.
